column1: 10/10 - Great job identifying the Marketing function as a potential area to benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies and providing a clear explanation of how it could operate. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how scrum/sprint could operate. Great job explaining the benefits and process of implementing scrum/sprint in marketing. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Overly general description of poor fit; not specific to this function.

Comment: You mentioned that kanban may not be a good choice for marketing due to its unpredictable nature, but more specific reasons for why it is a poor fit for this function would strengthen your argument.

10 pts - Great job identifying the distribution function as a suitable candidate for implementing kanban methodologies and providing a detailed example of a kanban board for this function. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job on providing a detailed kanban board example and explaining its benefits for the distribution function.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit

Comment: Good attempt at explaining why scrum/sprint may not be suitable for distribution, but could provide more specific reasons related to the function.
4 pts - The availability bias is mentioned, but its relevance to the situation could be clearer. Good suggestions on how to avoid the bias.

8/10 - You provided a good definition of the availability bias and explained how it could be problematic for Jackson's decision making. However, your suggestions for avoiding the bias could be more specific and actionable. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job in addressing the prompt and providing detailed explanations!

8 pts - Reasonable description, but missing some detail. 

Your response provides a good understanding of the concepts and their application, but could use more detail in some areas. Keep up the good work!
